method.name: POST
method.doc: To test the appliance DNS resolution for a given hostname, issue an HTTP POST command on the lookup URI. This API uses the nslookup utility and optionally allows a specific DNS to be specified for the query.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: host
param.doc: The hostname which the appliance will attempt to resolve.

param.name: server
param.doc: This optional parameter can be used to specify a particular DNS to use for the lookup. If this parameter is not provided, the appliance will use the current active DNS(s).

response.doc: OK, the server executed a query based on the request. To determine if the query itself was successful, inspect the rc property of the response.

param.name: output
param.doc: The output from the nslookup utility. This data contains newline characters 'n'.

param.name: rc
param.doc: The return code from the nslookup utility. This will be '0' if the query succeeded.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
